subject: Error on TestCase subclass in Eclipse 1.0
msgSnippet: I am using Eclipse 1.0 with JUnit, but when I create my TestCase subclass, I get an error on that line that states: The constructor junit.framework.TestCase()
messageBody:
I am using Eclipse 1.0 with JUnit, but when I create my TestCase subclass, I get an error on that line that states:

"The constructor junit.framework.TestCase() is not visible"

I am using JUnit 3.7.

Here is my code:


package junit.samples.money;

import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {

}


A more detailed dump of the error is:

java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problem:
The constructor junit.framework.TestCase() is not visible

at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Native Method)
at junit.samples.money.MyTestCase.<init>(MyTestCase.java:5)
at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.getTest(RemoteTestRunner.java:145)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.getTest(RemoteTestRunner.java:134)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTestRunner.java:187)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRunner.java:116)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:68)


Thanks,

Mark
